title.value: GAGE: Genetic Algorithm-based Graph Explainer for Malware Analysis
title.justification: The title is taken directly from the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: GAGE: Genetic Algorithm-based Graph Explainer for Malware Analysis

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel method for malware analysis using graph representations with a focus on a new Portable Executable representation called Canonical Executable Graph (CEG). It introduces a Genetic Algorithm-based Graph Explainer (GAGE) to provide interpretability in Deep Learning models for detecting and understanding malware behavior.

type.justification: The research involves experiments, model development, and the application of the proposed methods to real-world malware data, which characterizes empirical research.
type.quote: Through experiments and comparisons, our proposed pipeline exhibits substantial improvements in model robustness scores and discriminative power compared to the previous benchmarks.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on enhancing malware analysis and providing solutions to improve cybersecurity through the proposed methods.
name.quote: This research offers a robust solution to enhance cybersecurity by delivering a transparent and accurate understanding of malware behaviour.

name.justification: The paper contributes to the explainability of AI models specifically in the context of malware analysis, which relates to Explainable AI.
name.quote: ...recognizing the limitations of existing graph explanation methods within Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) for malware anal- ysis...

name.justification: The use of Canonical Executable Graph (CEG) as part of the learning method aligns the paper with graph-based learning sub-field.
name.quote: The proposed research introduces a structured pipeline for reverse engineering-based analysis, offer- ing promising results compared to state-of-the-art methods and providing high-level interpretability for malicious code blocks in subgraphs.

name.justification: The GAGE is introduced as a central model in the paper designed to improve interpretability of malware analysis models.
name.quote: We introduce GAGE, a specialized model-agnostic graph explainer designed explicitly for the intricate task of malware behaviour detection.

is_contributed.justification: GAGE is a novel contribution of this paper to aid in malware analysis.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce GAGE, a specialized model-agnostic graph explainer designed explicitly for the intricate task of malware behaviour detection.

is_executed.justification: GAGE is implemented and tested within the experiments discussed in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Through experiments and comparisons, our proposed pipeline exhibits substantial improvements...

is_compared.justification: GAGE is explicitly compared with other models like CFGExplainer in terms of performance and robustness.
is_compared.quote: In this section, we present a comparative analysis of the performance of our proposed model GAGE against the state-of-the-art CFGExplainer.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper introduces this model without referencing any prior work specifically for GAGE.

name.justification: The GCNN is mentioned as employed for classifying CEGs into malicious or benign.
name.quote: We employ a GCNN for this classification task.

is_contributed.justification: GCNNs are well-known models and were not introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We employ a GCNN for this classification task.

is_executed.justification: GCNNs are used and executed as part of the experiments for classifying graphs.
is_executed.quote: In our research, the classification of CEGs into benign and malicious families is essential. To achieve this, we utilize a GCNN, a robust framework designed for graph-based data classification.

is_compared.justification: The paper doesn't explicitly mention comparing GCNNs with other graph classification models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: GCNNs are a standard method discussed in the context of this paper without specific reference to one paper.

name.justification: The dataset MalShare is explicitly mentioned as used for obtaining malicious executables for the research.
name.quote: The dataset for this research comprises malicious executables obtained from MalShare...

referenced_paper_title.justification: MalShare is a well-known dataset repository and is not tied to a specific referencing paper in this context.

name.justification: The dataset VirusShare is explicitly mentioned as used for obtaining malicious executables for the research.

referenced_paper_title.justification: VirusShare is a well-known dataset repository and is not tied to a specific referencing paper in this context.

name.justification: The MUTAG dataset is mentioned as a real-world data set used to validate the results of the proposed method.
name.quote: ...specifically the MUTAG dataset, to validate our results.

referenced_paper_title.justification: MUTAG is a commonly referenced dataset in graph-based classification studies without a specific reference provided.

name.justification: PalmTree is mentioned as a library used for processing assembly instructions in the context of feature extraction.
name.quote: These instruction blocks are then processed using the PalmTree library, a pre-trained model on assembly...

referenced_paper_title.value: ...by PalmTree, where m denotes the number of instructions...
referenced_paper_title.justification: The library is used for feature extraction relevant to the research and not referenced from another specific paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: These instruction blocks are then processed using the PalmTree library, a pre-trained model on assembly...

name.justification: IDA Pro is a tool mentioned directly related to disassembling binaries, which is essential in data preparation for the research.
name.quote: Following the disassembling of PE files using IDA Pro, we extract blocks of assembly instructions.

referenced_paper_title.value: ...using IDA Pro, we extract blocks of assembly instructions...
referenced_paper_title.justification: IDA Pro is a commonly used disassembler in malware analysis and not directly derived from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Following the disassembling of PE files using IDA Pro, we extract blocks of assembly instructions.
